So, as an average user, I read carefully the instructions and I have one question. It's about recommendation to disable the option "Automatic Live Update" at "Settings/Computer settings"? Hmmm... Norton 360 v 5.0.0.125 seems to have detected the trial reset.....
If it detects the Trial Reset torrent (the archived files) it resets to original date.  However, when I removed the archive, it goes back to 150 days.

Norton is now scanning your hard drive and resets the trial reset if you have this file on your hard drive.  You will need to move it to an external drive.  Also, Norton detects it as a trojan now, whereas two weeks ago it did not.  Still seems to work though.

By storing files in an excluded folder they can't be detected and can be normally used.

The NTR can also be stored in a paasworded archive (RAR, ZIP,etc) so a virusscanner
can't detected it anymore.

@6545342de7

Any PASSWORDED archive (ISO, RAR, ZIP, bla bla bla) cannot be scanned. That's at least what I know.
Dont let Norton autoscan your computer for the first time just after install. Then go to settings and exlude archived files (rar, zip...) from scan. As simple as that...;-)
working perfect

@ robbing hood
yeah maybe , i think it depend on the MD5 hash code .

i think if they want  a file blacklisted , symantec 
downloads the crack , and  makes a MD5 hash code from the file.

they make a different hash number when its in a RAR file.

they put those MD5 numbers in their DATABASE ,and voila.
the file gets removed during scan when the scan sees the identical MD5 code..

@6545342de7

By using free online scanners for cracks all crack signatures are simply collected, which makes it easy to add crack signatures to any virus data base.

That's why I don't understand why people are using online scanners. 
Besides, online av scanners are not reliable and don't use updates and premium av signatures, cause that's where people have to pay for.

UPDATE NOTE:
-----------------

My NIS 18.5.0.125 was updated today (16 may 2011) from v18.5.0.125 to v18.6.0.29 through a LiveUpdate.
No matter what the settings of Norton are, if there's a new version build update avalaible 
it will be downloaded and installed through updating.

NTR v3.3.1 still works, but it's not sure yet if the version build update may cause problems 
when uninstalling NTR v3.3.1 cause I didn't try yet to uninstall NTR v3.3.1 on Norton 18.6.0.29.

Also I'm not sure yet if NTR v3.3.1 works for the separate installer of Norton 18.6.0.29,
cause my Norton was updated internally through an update.

Hope this Helps:  The Reset tool only works if the Norton Product is shut down completely.  If you see "unable to shut down Norton" message forget the reboot and use a good Process Killer utility.  You'll see two black & yellow squares in the process column with the word 'symantec' to the right.  Shut down the System one AND the User, also.
Then run the NTS.
My Norton 360 was down to 11 days, and was kicked up to 180.  Seriously, try it.  Thanks RobbingHood,  excellent Up.
